Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Dermot O’Leary and Emma Willis opened the BRIT Awards 2017 with a tribute to Michael Buble, who pulled out of hosting the show after his young son was diagnosed with cancer.
Taking to the stage at London’s O2 Arena, the co-hosts sent their love to Michael and said although they were thrilled to be hosting, they would rather be in the audience watching Michael on stage.
Dermot said: "While Emma and I are so happy to be your hosts, we would much rather be down there in the audience, watching Michael Buble up here."
Emma added: “We so wish he could have been with us this evening and everybody at the BRITs sends him all of our love and fingers crossed we will see him again next year.”
They made sure to mention Michael (Photo: ITV) Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in  How to watch The Brit Awards 2017 Share this video Watch Next Read More When are the Brit Awards 2017? Nominations, presenters and how to watch the show Michael pulled out of hosting the show (Photo: WireImage) Canadian singer Michael pulled out of hosting the BRIT Awards following the tragic news that his three-year-old son had been diagnosed with liver cancer.
Mum of three, Emma said before the show: “Every part of me sends so much love and all the best wishes in the world to Michael and his family at such a difficult time.
“I’m a huge fan of his and I would have relished watching him present the Brits. I know everyone involved wants to make the best show possible and I hope we do him proud.”
Read More Emma Willis gets booed by Celebrity Big Brother fans after telling Jasmine Waltz to 'rein in the language' Emma Willis on the BRIT Awards red carpet (Photo: PA) Dermot with his wife Dee at the O2 Arena (Photo: PA) Read More Brit Awards 2017 nominations REVEALED: Little Mix and Rihanna score most nods Dermot added: “Michael is an effortless showman, so those patent shoes will not be easy to fill.
“But it’s an honour to be asked to step in with Emma to host the Brits.”
Brits chairman Jason Iley didn’t rule out Michael returning to host the show in the future. He said: "Our thoughts go out to Michael and his family. We would love to see him on our stage in the future."
Michael Bublé pulled out after his son was diagnosed with cancer (Photo: Getty) But added about Dermot and Emma: "They are currently the most in demand presenters in the UK, with a huge passion for music, and to get the both of them is very exciting for us."
Chart-topping singer Michael cancelled all work commitments last year following Noah’s devastating diagnosis in November, and told Brit Award bosses he would not be attending.
Doctors have given toddler Noah 90% chance of survival and he is currently undergoing chemotherapy with Michael, 41, and his actress wife Luisana Lopilato , 29, by his side.
Emma and Dermot host rival shows The Voice and The X Factor The couple have a second son Elias, who is one.
A source said: “It is a delicate situation due to the nature of Noah’s illness. No pressure was ever put on Michael to fulfil his obligations.
“He will always be welcome at the BRITs but it’s important that he is with his family. It would not look good to be singing and dancing on stage while his son is so ill.”
